item.title: Woman dies days after hospital gives her overdoses of paracetamol: Report - The Times of India
item.description:
Woman dies days after hospital gives her overdoses of paracetamol: Report

Date: April 19, 2017 Source: The Liverpool Echo

In an unfortunate incident, a mom of two, named Laura Higginson, died days after being administered staggered overdoses of paracetamol. She was admitted to the hospital with suspected pneumonia and received excessive doses before the medical team recognized their error.

  • Laura Higginson was a 30-year-old woman weighing less than 40 kilos.
  • She was given inappropriate doses of paracetamol over several days.
  • Her health deteriorated leading to her death on April 19 due to multi-organ failure.
  • The hospital admitted to the dosing error but claimed the antidote prevented fatal consequences.
  • The issue is currently under legal scrutiny, being subjudice.
“While paracetamol is generally safe when used correctly, overdosing can lead to serious health issues, including liver failure.”

This tragic case stresses the importance of careful medication management and monitoring in healthcare settings.

item.title: Osamu Suzuki, who led Japanese automaker into India, dies at 94 - The Hindu
item.description:
Osamu Suzuki, Pioneer of Suzuki Motor and Indian Auto Market, Dies at 94

Date: December 27, 2024

Source: [Source Name]

Osamu Suzuki, a legendary figure in the automotive industry and former chairman of Suzuki Motor Corporation, passed away at the age of 94 on Christmas Day due to lymphoma. He was instrumental in transforming the Indian auto market and expanding Suzuki's global reach.

  • Suzuki led Suzuki Motor for over 40 years, significantly impacting the automotive landscape.
  • He focused on cost efficiency, which shaped the company's operations, including lowering factory ceilings for savings.
  • Under his leadership, Suzuki launched the Maruti 800, revolutionizing the Indian car market.
  • Suzuki played a key role in establishing a partnership with Maruti at a time when India had limited car production.
  • His quirky personality and humor were noted, often playfully stating he would stay with the company 'forever.'
  • The company he built retains about 40% of the Indian car market today.
“To be number one somewhere in the world” was his motivation for investing in India.

Osamu Suzuki’s legacy will continue through the ongoing success of Maruti Suzuki, marking a significant chapter in automotive history.

item.description:
China’s new stealth fighter jet could be a 'game-changer'

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The recent unveiling of China's new stealth fighter jet has raised significant attention, with experts suggesting it could redefine aerial combat dynamics.

  • The aircraft features advanced stealth technology designed to evade radar detection.
  • Potential implications for military strategy and power balance in the Asia-Pacific region.
  • Experts emphasize the importance of international monitoring in light of this development.
'This aircraft could change the rules of engagement in modern warfare.'

Overall, this new stealth fighter jet represents a substantial advancement in military aviation and has prompted discussions on future global security challenges.

item.title: Irfan Pathan, Sanjay Manjrekar collide on live TV over Virat Kohli-Yashasvi Jaiswal run-out: 'Fine, you only speak then' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Irfan Pathan and Sanjay Manjrekar Clash Over Kohli-Jaiswal Run-Out on Live TV

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: HT Sports

Former Indian cricketers Irfan Pathan and Sanjay Manjrekar had a heated exchange on live television regarding a critical run-out incident involving Virat Kohli and Yashasvi Jaiswal during a Test match against Australia.

  • Pathan and Manjrekar disagreed on the run-out of Jaiswal following a communication error with Kohli.
  • India was placed at 153/2 before losing three wickets for six runs due to the incident.
  • Manjrekar criticized Kohli for not being more proactive, while Pathan defended the non-striker's call in a heated debate.
  • Manjrekar suggested a new coaching manual based on Pathan's approach to running between wickets.
“If you don't want to listen, there isn't much left here,” said Manjrekar, highlighting the tensions during the debate.

Regardless of the argument, India's position in the game has weakened, trailing by 310 runs with five wickets down.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim May Use New ALoP Technology for Compact Camera Module, Better Image Quality - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim May Use New ALoP Technology for Camera

Publication Date: December 26, 2024

Source: Gadgets 360

Samsung is expected to unveil the Galaxy S25 Slim, which will feature the newly developed ALoP (All Lenses on Prism) technology for its telephoto camera, aiming for a thinner device without sacrificing image quality. Leaks suggest that the phone will have a periscope telephoto camera that minimizes the camera bump.

  • Galaxy S25 Slim to debut alongside Galaxy S25 series.
  • ALoP technology reduces camera bump size by shortening telephoto module length by 22%.
  • The device is expected to be under 7mm thick.
  • Triple rear camera setup includes a 200-megapixel ISOCELL HP5 sensor.
  • Pre-orders to start from January 24 to February 3, with potential sales from February 4.
"Confirmed ✅ The S25 Slim features ALoP technology. This allows for a reduction in the thickness of the camera bump, solving the issue of the camera bump appearing protruded." — Jukanlosreve

The Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim is set to be a significant advancement in smartphone camera technology, offering a more accessible design without compromising functionality.

item.title: Max Box Office Day 2: Only 3.51 Crores Away From Creating History With Highest Opening Weekend In Sandalwood! - Koimoi
item.description:
Max Box Office Day 2: Only 3.51 Crores Away From Creating History With Highest Opening Weekend In Sandalwood!

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: Koimoi

Kannada action thriller Max began on an impressive note at the box office. Kichcha Sudeep starrer has unfortunately witnessed a big drop on its second day, despite good reviews.

  • Day 1: 8.7 crores
  • Day 2: 4 crores
  • Total: 12.7 crores

Over 50% drop

As per Sacnilk, Max earned around 4 crores on its day 2 at the Kannada box office. It has witnessed a drop of 54% compared to 8.7 crores on day 1, registering the highest opening for a Sandalwood film in 2024.

Kichcha Sudeep starrer Max only needs 3.51 crores more to score the biggest opening weekend of Sandalwood in 2024.

Stay tuned to Koimoi for more box office updates!

item.title: Nissan Megadeal Sets Up Next Fight for Bankers in Japan M&A Boom | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Nissan Megadeal Sets Up Next Fight for Bankers in Japan M&A Boom

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: Bloomberg

Japan is experiencing unprecedented dealmaking activity in 2023, with a 48% increase in mergers and acquisitions volume, reaching approximately $200 billion. Meanwhile, the prospect of Honda's acquisition talks with Nissan is reshaping the competitive landscape for investment bankers.

  • Record M&A activity of $200 billion in Japan, up 48% from the previous year.
  • Honda and Nissan in discussions to create a joint holding company by August 2026.
  • Local banks dominate deal advisory roles due to strong corporate relationships.
  • Foreign firms struggle to gain traction against Japanese mega banks in strategic sectors.
  • Growing influence of activist investors pushing for increased shareholder value.
“This is the busiest ever we have seen in Japan dealmaking,” said Takeshi Nakao, managing partner at Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer LLP.

In conclusion, the thriving M&A environment in Japan coupled with strategic partnerships highlights the evolving landscape where local firms maintain a significant edge, underscored by rising investor activism.

item.title: Former Suzuki Motor Chairman Osamu Suzuki, who led company for 40 years, dies at 94 - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Former Suzuki Motor Chairman Osamu Suzuki, Who Led Company for 40 Years, Dies at 94

Published on: December 25, 2024
Source: CNBC TV18

Osamu Suzuki, former chairman of Japan's Suzuki Motor, has died at the age of 94. He led the company for over 40 years, transforming it into a global automaker.

  • Born on January 30, 1930, in Gero, Gifu Prefecture, Japan.
  • Led Suzuki as president from 1978, significantly expanding its global presence.
  • Strategically formed alliances with General Motors and Volkswagen.
  • Pioneered the company’s success in affordable small vehicles in India.
  • Stepped down as CEO amidst a fuel efficiency testing scandal in 2016.
  • Returned as president during the 2008 financial crisis to stabilize the company.
  • Passed away due to lymphoma on December 25, 2024.
“If I were to listen to everybody, it would make things too slow,” Osamu Suzuki wrote in his memoir.

Osamu Suzuki's leadership was marked by a relentless drive for progress and decisiveness, influencing the automotive industry significantly over his lengthy career.

item.title: Tamil Nadu BJP's Annamalai whips himself seeking justice in Anna University sexual assault case | Video - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BJP Leader Annamalai Protests for Justice in Anna University Assault Case

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Tamil Nadu Bharatiya Janata Party president K Annamalai has protested in Coimbatore by whipping himself to demand justice for a 19-year-old girl allegedly sexually assaulted at Anna University.

  • Annamalai announced plans to fast for 48 days and vowed to not wear footwear until the DMK is removed from power.
  • He held a press conference stating he will whip himself six times as part of his protest.
  • Protests by BJP and AIADMK leaders occurred on December 26, resulting in police detentions.
  • The BJP leader criticized the DMK government for rising crimes against women in Tamil Nadu.
  • Police confirmed the arrest of an individual linked to the case.
“This is atrocious. They want to crush our voice.” - Tamilisai Soundararajan

The protest highlights significant public dissent regarding safety and justice for women in Tamil Nadu.

item.title: Lava Yuva 2 budget 5G phone launched with backlight design: Price, specs - Business Standard
item.description:
Lava Yuva 2 budget 5G phone launched with backlight design: Price, specs

Last Updated: Dec 27 2024 | Source: Business Standard

The Lava Yuva 2 5G smartphone is designed with a unique backlight feature that blinks for calls and notifications. It comes equipped with modern specifications at an affordable price.

  • Price: Rs 9,499
  • Available Colors: Marble Black, Marble White
  • Processor: Unisoc T760
  • RAM: 4GB (expandable with virtual RAM)
  • Storage: 128GB
  • Display: 6.67-inch HD+, 90Hz refresh rate
  • Rear Camera: 50MP + 2MP
  • Front Camera: 8MP
  • Battery: 5000mAh with 18W charging
"The smartphone features a punch-hole design display and a dual-camera set-up at the back with artificial intelligence-powered imaging features."

In conclusion, Lava has introduced an appealing budget smartphone aimed at providing essential features and stylish design to the consumers.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 4th Test Day 2: IND 164/5 vs AUS at Stumps in Melbourne - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 4th Test Day 2

Date: December 2024

Source: Indian Express

At the end of Day 2, India stands at 164/5, still trailing by 310 runs against Australia in the ongoing 4th Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

  • Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja remain unbeaten.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal scored 82 before being run out.
  • India's bowlers managed to take four wickets from Australia, with Jasprit Bumrah leading with four wickets.
  • Steven Smith's outstanding 140 runs contributed to Australia's total of 474 runs.
“Some good bowling combined with poor decision making from the Indians have resulted in the end of Day 2 with visitors at 164/5.”

As the match progresses, India will need a strong performance to catch up with Australia’s significant lead.

item.title: Australia’s late blitz blitz puts India on back foot on day two of Boxing Day Test – as it happened - The Guardian
item.description:
Boxing Day Test 2024: Australia vs India fourth men’s cricket Test, day two – live updates

Date: Fri 27 Dec 2024 02.15 EST

Source: Guardian

Day two of the Boxing Day Test witnessed a dramatic collapse from India, who lost three wickets for just 13 runs towards the end of play, leaving them trailing by 310 runs.

  • Australia declared at 474, with Steve Smith scoring 140 runs.
  • India was at 164-5 at stumps, with Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja at the crease.
  • Key wickets fell in quick succession, including that of Virat Kohli.
  • Sam Konstas had a standout debut on day one, setting the stage for Australia's batting dominance.
  • Jasprit Bumrah took four wickets for India, showing glimpses of resistance despite the team's collapse.
“All hope isn’t lost for India with the destructive pair of Pant and Jadeja at the crease but the deficit is more than chunky.”

The day ended with India in a precarious position, needing a strong performance from the lower order to recover from their latest batting failures.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 2 Highlights: India Hit Self-Destruct Button, Slump To 164/5 At Stumps - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 2 Highlights: India Hit Self-Destruct Button, Slump To 164/5 At Stumps

Date: Not specified
Source: NDTV

This article highlights the dismal performance of the Indian cricket team during the second day of the 4th Test against Australia, marking a significant slump in their batting.

  • India struggled to manage their batting, finishing the day at 164/5.
  • Key players fell cheaply, contributing to a self-destructive approach.
  • The Australian bowlers exploited the conditions effectively.
“It’s a disappointing display from the Indian batsmen, who seemed to lose their way after a promising start.”

The stark contrast in performance between India and Australia indicates a need for the Indian team to reassess their strategy ahead of the remaining days of the Test match.

item.title: Zupee Brings Innovation to Gaming with Blockchain Solutions - BusinessLine
item.description:
Zupee Brings Innovation to Gaming with Blockchain Solutions

Updated - December 27, 2024 by The Hindu Business Line

Zupee, a leading name in skill-based gaming, is transforming the gaming industry by integrating blockchain technology into its platform, enhancing security, fairness, and transparency.

  • Zupee utilizes a tamper-proof Random Number Generator (RNG) powered by blockchain for unbiased game outcomes.
  • All game results are recorded on an immutable ledger, allowing players to independently verify results.
  • The platform complies with Indian regulatory standards by publishing RNG data on the blockchain.
  • Blockchain technology enhances security, ensuring player data is protected and disputes are easily resolved.
  • This integration represents a significant advancement in the online gaming industry, fostering trust and empowering players.
“By prioritizing fairness, transparency, security, and player empowerment, the platform has set new standards for what gamers can expect.”

Zupee's innovation signifies a shift towards a more transparent and secure gaming experience, influencing the future of the gaming industry.

item.title: Understanding Mars Helicopter Ingenuity’s Last Flight On Mars - Astrobiology News
item.description:
Understanding Mars Helicopter Ingenuity's Last Flight On Mars

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Astrobiology

This review takes a close look at the final flight of the agency’s Ingenuity Mars Helicopter, which was the first aircraft to fly on another world.

  • Ingenuity completed its final flight on January 18, 2024.
  • During its mission, it performed 72 flights and flew over 30 times farther than planned.
  • The navigation system failure during Flight 72 likely caused the end of the mission.
  • Despite being grounded, Ingenuity continues to send weather data to the Perseverance rover.
  • Future Mars helicopters may benefit from the findings of Ingenuity's investigation.
“When running an accident investigation from 100 million miles away, you don’t have any black boxes or eyewitnesses.” – Håvard Grip, Ingenuity’s first pilot

Ingenuity’s success and longevity will guide the design of future Mars aerial vehicles, with potential for exploration of terrains unreachable by rovers.

item.title: Dr. Manmohan Singh death: Business leaders mourn demise of late former Indian PM - The Hindu
item.description:
Dr. Manmohan Singh death: Business leaders mourn demise of late former Indian PM

Date: December 27, 2024 12:00 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

Former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh, an influential leader and the architect of modern India, passed away at the age of 92. Tributes poured in from business leaders and industry fellows who recognized his contributions to the country's economic landscape.

  • Dr. Singh was recognized for his role in modernizing India and inspiring global respect with his leadership.
  • Business leaders like N. Chandrasekaran and Kumar Mangalam Birla highlighted his contributions to India's economic reforms.
  • The U.S.-India Business Council expressed condolences and acknowledged his role in strengthening U.S.-India relationships.
“India has lost one of its tallest leaders and finest economists.” - Kumar Mangalam Birla

The passing of Dr. Manmohan Singh marks a significant loss for India, reflecting on his legacy of vision and transformation in the liberalization of the economy.

item.title: Want to Know the Truth About Kanury Rao: A Visionary Leader in the Immunology Field? - Business Standard
item.description:
Want to Know the Truth About Kanury Rao: A Visionary Leader in the Immunology Field?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Dr. Kanury Rao is a prominent figure in immunology, known for his significant contributions to the field, particularly in cancer research and patient care. His dedication to understanding the immune system has led to advancements that improve health outcomes.

Key Points

  • Dr. Rao has significantly contributed to immunology, focusing on cancer immunotherapy and autoimmune disorders.
  • He co-founded PredOmix Technologies and is the head of the Drug Discovery Research Centre at THSTI.
  • His research aids in the development of critical vaccines and treatments.
  • Recognized with prestigious awards like the Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize and the National Bioscience Award.
  • Despite facing false allegations in his career, he continued to focus on his research and contributions to the field.
“Success requires a lot of hard work and dedication and sidelining all obstacles and difficulties in the path of success.” - Dr. Kanury Rao

Dr. Rao’s contributions to immunology are vital in developing treatments for diseases affecting many lives. His resilience in overcoming challenges further exemplifies his dedication to advancing medical research.

item.title: Manmohan Singh's decisions that shaped a billion lives - BBC.com
item.description:
Manmohan Singh's decisions that shaped a billion lives

Published on: Recent date
Source: BBC News, Delhi

People in India are reflecting on former Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's contribution to the country since his death on Thursday evening. Singh served two consecutive terms as Prime Minister from 2004 to 2014 and was a key architect of India’s economic liberalization.

  • Singh's economic reforms lifted millions out of poverty and set India on a path of rapid economic growth.
  • He was seen as a reluctant Prime Minister who eventually marked his authority during his tenure.
  • Under his leadership, significant social reforms such as the Right to Information and the National Rural Employment Guarantee Act were introduced.
  • He formally apologized for the 1984 anti-Sikh riots.
  • Singh's government signed a historic nuclear deal with the US in 2008.
"I have no hesitation in apologising to the Sikh community. I apologise not only to the Sikh community, but to the whole Indian nation."

Singh's leadership and reforms have had a lasting impact on India's trajectory, both economically and socially, and his legacy continues to influence Indian politics.

item.title: Incremental investment in cement sector will come only when profitability improves: Report | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Incremental Investment in Cement Sector Dependent on Profitability Improvements

Publication Date: December 27, 2023 Source: ANI

The Indian cement industry must improve its profitability significantly to attract future investments, as highlighted in a report by IKIGAI Asset Manager. The report states that EBITDA must exceed Rs1,000 per ton to justify returns on capital.

  • The report cites a current EBITDA of Rs800 per ton, leading to a post-tax ROCE of only 3%.
  • Incremental investments will require doubling current profitability.
  • India's combined listed cement companies have a market capitalization exceeding USD100 billion.
  • Top four players are expected to account for over 75% of capacity additions by FY27.
  • More than 25% of limestone mines will expire by 2035, posing future challenges.
  • Shifting to renewable energy could reduce operational costs significantly.
  • Despite being the second-largest market, cement is among the cheapest commodities in India.
  • The growth in cement demand historically follows GDP growth, but pricing power remains low.
“Each Rs1 increase in cement price per bag could add Rs67 billion to the EBITDA of the top 10 players.”

The future growth of the industry depends on demand dynamics, strategic pricing, and the adoption of cost-effective renewable energy solutions.
